name: Hibiscus Coffee and Guesthouse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at Hibiscus upon the recommendations of friends who stayed at the Inn and others who have visited the area. It was perfect!
reviews.title: Perfect Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The cafe is obviously the hub to the community. A happy place with happy people. The food was incredible, the staff attentive and friendly.
reviews.title: Interesting location- lodging not so much

reviews.text: Would highly suggest you visit Grayton Beach and stay at Hibiscus.
reviews.title: Great midway spot between Pensacola and Panama City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Based on the Trip Advisor reviews we read we were really looking forward to our stay. Maybe we just got a bad room. All the rooms have names. Ours was called "The Big Easy". The bed was uncomfortable. There was no dresser. We set up an ironing board to put our clothes on rather than keep them in the suitcases. The shower was not very good. The bathroom mirror was pitiful. Since these are all things we want in a room we were disappointed.
reviews.title: Great for Pet Owners and Laid Back Travelers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the perfect spot for my boyfriend and I to stay. We stayed here for 5 nights and it was wonderful. The hibiscus is very close to the beach and only about a 30 minute drive from Destin or to Panama City. It's cute, comfortable and so charming. We were so glad we stayed here instead of a crowded, boring hotel. The breakfast was delicious, the room was adorable and just big enough. We weren't in there much during the day anyway. I would recommend this to anyone.
reviews.title: Exactly What I wanted!

reviews.text: My wife and I decided to take a last minute trip to Grayton Beach for a long weekend. After searching the internet for several hours, we found many rental properties in the area to choose from, but none could match the value of the Hibiscus guesthouse.
reviews.title: Best Value in the Area!

reviews.text: Often you get what you pay for, but this is definitely not the case here. The property is set up so that the rooms have separate entrances (although some rooms share a common kitchen area). I personally preferred this to other “Bed & Breakfasts” I have stayed at. The room in which we stayed was very spacious and had a small kitchenette. The breakfast was fabulous and by itself is a reason to stay here. There is a restaurant and general store located next door to the guest house which was very convenient. The only drawback that some may find with the location is that it is about a 1/4 mile walk to the beach. Not a particularly big drawback for us as there are many outlets to the beach a short drive away.
reviews.title: Relaxed Comfortable Inn Surrounded by Nature in Grayton Beach

likes.liked: — grayton beach location, natural surroundings, free bikes, breakfasts!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Travelling on business in Pensacola with a weekend off, I decided to check out the Emerald Coast of Florida. I did not make an advance reservation at the Hibiscus, but with good fortune I found this peaceful haven in Grayton Beach. My room, the hibiscus room, was the cheapest at $120 a night. As a budget minded traveller, I found this area overall to be quite expensive so the rate was a pretty good value considering that a filling, healthy and yummy vegetarian breakfast was included. If you are not an early riser like me, I would recommend that you do NOT choose one of the rooms above the cafe. The cafe begins bustling at 7am and may disturb those who enjoy sleeping late or seeking quiet space. The facilities (bed, bath, internet connection) were all good. It was a little chilly the first night as my room did not have its own heater. Fortunately, I had the place to myself so I turned up the heat in an adjacent room. I found my room to be the perfect size for a solo traveller, maybe too small if you are travelling with a spouse or friend. The mature, natural landscape that surrounds the inn is fantastic. The friendly staff are available during the day. After hours is available by phone. --- Grayton Beach is sandwiched between Destin/Miramar beach to the west which is bustling and crowded. Watercolor/Seaside/Rosemary Beach are to the new exclusive communities to the east which seem to sterile and plastic for my liking.
reviews.title: " A slice of Heaven "

likes.liked: — Relaxed CmmunityLack of indoor seating area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently spent 6 days at the Hibiscus Cafe and Guesthouse
reviews.title: Charm is the biggest amenity here

likes.disliked: — modern day luxuries like lack of Internet service quality, water pressure, small room size, no working outlet in restroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First off the 30-A Scenic Highway along the Emerald Coast of Florida we drove down to see the beach first, that fantastic sugar white sand--I had to get my toes in it & wade in the water & just walk for awhile along the shore...
reviews.title: from the little easy to The Big Easy?!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After driving from Navarre Beach we decided to eat lunch at The Red Bar in Grayton Beach - which I'd read about, then when I saw their iconic painted door I was captivated & had to go in...we were shown a big chalkboard for the menu of the day that I guess they change up when the cook decides - so we had the fish 'n chips & a burger between the two of us, while soaking up all the atmosphere/people watched/notice a disco ball/strung lights on & got to check out all the walls/ceilings full of posters/crazy stuff while we ate (OK, so a few pesky flies tried to join us--life isn't perfect, it is the beach & lots of folks coming & going so no worse than a picnic...)
reviews.title: Great visit

reviews.text: We almost stayed at the beach state park further down 30-A, in their rent cabins - but instead went into the town of Grayton Beach to find the Hibiscus Coffee & Guesthouse had a room for two nights...of all the rooms, The Big Easy--full of you guessed it, New Orleans posters & fun stuff...we had just driven from Lafayette, LA which a few folks will jokingly call 'the little easy' - of course loved it...it's really more than a room, it's a separate little cottage behind the main guesthouse with our own piece of deck & wooden deck chairs out the front door (actually it can also be the handicapped room, but we enjoyed it just as well...)
reviews.title: Another terrific stay

reviews.text: Two nights near the beach, is my idea of heaven - we could borrow the beach bikes parked out front of the office & ride off to the beach...which we did the next morning after we rode back to the state park as well because I wanted to walk among the sand dunes next to one of the few dune lakes along the Emerald Coast & that it is--emerald & blue colored with white sugar sand at the shore - my fav part of Florida (though I grew up down in St. Pete...)
reviews.title: Just wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was funny to see on the lake there were not just kayaks or canoes but also those paddleboards that look like surfboards you stand up on & paddle in the water--later we would find the locals called them Yolo boards - or Yoloyaks maybe - & you could rent them, like the bikes & all else to go out on the water in (instead we rode our bikes or walked on the beach, another time for Yolo's?!)
reviews.title: Incredible!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Found Hibiscus on web search when we decided to take a tour around northern Florida. Left Tampa and headed to St. Augustine for two nights, then on to the panhandle.
reviews.title: Total Relaxation

likes.liked: — On site coffeehouse and the great room furnishings that made for real comfort.

reviews.title: Loved it!
reviews.text: The web gave a glowing review of the Grayton Beach area and mentioned the Hibiscus. To me it looked very interesting and of the type of accommodation that would appeal to both my wife and I, so I made reservations (by telephone) for a couple of nights.

aka: Hibiscus Coffee And Guesthouse Hotel Grayton Beach
description: An old fashioned, romantic getaway, Hibiscus Coffee & Guesthouse, is just up the street from the sugar white sands of one of America's most beautiful beaches. We have 12 distinctly different accommodations, all furnished and decorated with a vintage Old Florida feel. All of our rooms have a cable TV and DVD player, mini or full-sized refrigerator, microwave oven, coffee pot, iron and ironing board, private bath and WiFi. In addition to pet friendly and kid friendly rooms, two of our accommodations have full kitchens and two others share a kitchen. As always, your stay includes a wonderful breakfast every morning in our on-site restaurant, Café Hibiscus.
